intro: Thouinia polygama, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, including South Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a waxy texture. Thouinia polygama is often found in sandy or rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
